title: Enacts the Responsible Bidders Database Act; requires state comptroller to maintain a database containing certain information for certain contracts
summary: Enacts the Responsible Bidders Database Act; requires the state comptroller to maintain a computerized database system containing certain information relating to contractors, for state agency and public authority contracts valued at one hundred thousand dollars or more.

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. DESTITO, GALEF, BRENNAN, MARKEY -- Multi-Spon-
         sored by -- M. of A.  CAHILL, COOK, DINOWITZ, LIFTON, MAGEE,  PHEFFER,

       AN ACT to amend the state finance law, in  relation  to  establishing  a
         responsible bidders database in the office of the state comptroller

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. This act shall be known and may be cited as the  "Responsi-
    2  ble Bidders Database Act".
    3    S  2.  The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 148 to
    4  read as follows:
    5    S  148.  RESPONSIBLE  BIDDERS  COMPUTERIZED  DATABASE;  REPORTING   OF
    6  CONTRACTED GOODS AND SERVICES. 1. THE STATE COMPTROLLER SHALL MAINTAIN A
    7  COMPUTERIZED  DATABASE  SYSTEM  THAT SHALL CONTAIN INFORMATION FOR EVERY
    8  CONTRACT FOR A STATE AGENCY OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY. THE  STATE  COMPTROLLER
    9  SHALL  MAINTAIN  THE INFORMATION REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION IN A FORM THAT
   10  WILL ENABLE EACH AGENCY AND PUBLIC AUTHORITY TO PERFORM ITS DUTIES.
   11    2. EACH STATE AGENCY AND PUBLIC AUTHORITY SHALL COLLECT  THE  INFORMA-
   12  TION  SET FORTH IN THIS SUBDIVISION FOR EACH CONTRACT THAT THE AGENCY OR
   13  PUBLIC AUTHORITY ENTERS INTO, AND SHALL PROVIDE THIS INFORMATION TO  THE
   14  STATE  COMPTROLLER.  THE  INFORMATION  SHALL  BE  SUBMITTED IN A FORM OR
   15  FORMAT AND ON A SCHEDULE TO BE DETERMINED BY THE STATE COMPTROLLER.  THE
   16  INFORMATION SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, AT LEAST THE FOLLOWING
   17  DATA:
   18    A.  THE  CURRENT  ADDRESSES  AND TELEPHONE NUMBERS OF THE CONTRACTOR'S
   19  PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICES AND THE CONTRACTOR'S PRIMARY PLACE OF  BUSI-
   20  NESS IN NEW YORK STATE, IF DIFFERENT.
   21    B. THE ADDRESSES OF THE THREE LARGEST SITES AT WHICH IT IS ANTICIPATED
   22  THAT WORK WOULD OCCUR IN CONNECTION WITH THE PROPOSED CONTRACT, BASED ON
   23  THE NUMBER OF PERSONS TO BE EMPLOYED AT EACH SITE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06371-01-1

       A. 2409                             2

    1    C.  ANY  OTHER NAMES UNDER WHICH THE CONTRACTOR HAS CONDUCTED BUSINESS
    2  WITHIN THE PRIOR FIVE YEARS.
    3    D.  THE  ADDRESSES  AND  TELEPHONE  NUMBERS OF ALL PRINCIPAL PLACES OF
    4  BUSINESS AND PRIMARY PLACES OF BUSINESS IN NEW YORK STATE, IF DIFFERENT,
    5  WHERE THE CONTRACTOR HAS CONDUCTED BUSINESS WITHIN THE PRIOR FIVE YEARS.
    6    E. THE DUN & BRADSTREET NUMBER OF THE CONTRACTOR, IF ANY.
    7    F.  THE  TAXPAYER  IDENTIFICATION  NUMBERS,  EMPLOYER   IDENTIFICATION
    8  NUMBERS OR SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBERS OF THE CONTRACTOR AND OF THE DIVISION
    9  OR  BRANCH  OF  THE  CONTRACTOR  WHICH  IS  ACTUALLY  ENTERING  INTO THE
   10  CONTRACT.
   11    G. THE TYPE OF BUSINESS ENTITY OF THE CONTRACTOR, INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT
   12  LIMITED  TO,  SOLE  PROPRIETORSHIP, PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE OR CORPO-
   13  RATION.
   14    H. THE DATE SUCH BUSINESS ENTITY WAS FORMED, THE  STATE,  COUNTY,  AND
   15  COUNTRY IF NOT WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, IN WHICH IT WAS FORMED, AND THE
   16  COUNTIES  WITHIN NEW YORK STATE IN WHICH IT HAS TRANSACTED OR DONE BUSI-
   17  NESS WITHIN THE PRIOR FIVE YEARS.
   18    I. THE PRINCIPAL OWNERS AND OFFICERS OF THE CONTRACTOR, THEIR DATES OF
   19  BIRTH, TAXPAYER IDENTIFICATION  NUMBERS,  SOCIAL  SECURITY  NUMBERS  AND
   20  THEIR CURRENT BUSINESS ADDRESSES AND TELEPHONE NUMBERS.
   21    J.  THE  NAMES,  CURRENT  BUSINESS  ADDRESSES  AND  TELEPHONE NUMBERS,
   22  TAXPAYER IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS AND EMPLOYER IDENTIFICATION  NUMBERS  OF
   23  AFFILIATES OF THE CONTRACTORS.
   24    K.  THE  PRINCIPAL OWNERS AND OFFICERS OF AFFILIATES OF THE CONTRACTOR
   25  AND THEIR CURRENT BUSINESS ADDRESSES AND TELEPHONE NUMBERS.
   26    L. THE PRINCIPAL OWNERS AND OFFICERS OF EVERY SUBCONTRACTOR.
   27    M. THE TYPE, AMOUNT AND CONTRACT  REGISTRATION  NUMBER  OF  ALL  OTHER
   28  CONTRACTS  AWARDED TO THE CONTRACTOR, AS REFLECTED IN THE DATABASE MAIN-
   29  TAINED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION.
   30    N. THE CONTRACT SANCTION HISTORY OF THE CONTRACTOR FOR THE PRIOR  FIVE
   31  YEARS,  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ALL CAUTIONS, SUSPENSIONS, DEBAR-
   32  MENTS, CANCELLATIONS OF A CONTRACT BASED UPON THE CONTRACTOR'S  BUSINESS
   33  CONDUCT,  DECLARATIONS  OF  DEFAULT  ON ANY CONTRACT MADE BY ANY GOVERN-
   34  MENTAL ENTITY, DETERMINATIONS OF INELIGIBILITY  TO  BID  OR  PROPOSE  ON
   35  CONTRACTS,  AND  WHETHER ANY PROCEEDINGS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY TO BID
   36  OR PROPOSE ON CONTRACTS ARE PENDING.
   37    O. THE CONTRACT SANCTION HISTORY FOR THE PRIOR FIVE  YEARS  OF  AFFIL-
   38  IATES  OF  THE  CONTRACTOR  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ALL CAUTIONS,
   39  SUSPENSIONS, DEBARMENTS, CANCELLATIONS OF A  CONTRACT  BASED  UPON  SUCH
   40  ENTITY'S  BUSINESS CONDUCT, DECLARATIONS OF DEFAULT ON ANY CONTRACT MADE
   41  BY ANY GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY, DETERMINATIONS OF INELIGIBILITY  TO  BID  OR
   42  PROPOSE  ON CONTRACTS AND WHETHER ANY PROCEEDINGS TO DETERMINE ELIGIBIL-
   43  ITY TO BID OR PROPOSE ON CONTRACTS ARE PENDING.
   44    P. THE NAME AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OF THE CHIEF CONTRACTING  OFFICER  OR
   45  OTHER EMPLOYEE OF THE AGENCY OR AUTHORITY RESPONSIBLE FOR SUPERVISION OF
   46  THOSE CHARGED WITH DAY-TO-DAY MANAGEMENT OF THE CONTRACT.
   47    Q.  JUDGMENTS,  MEDIATION  AND  ARBITRATION  DECISIONS  AND AWARDS AND
   48  INJUNCTIONS, ISSUED WITHIN THE PRIOR FIVE YEARS, IN ANY JUDICIAL ACTIONS
   49  OR PROCEEDINGS AND IN  ANY  MEDIATION  OR  ARBITRATION  PROCEEDINGS  AND
   50  INITIATED  BY  ANY  AGENCY OR PUBLIC OFFICER AGAINST THE CONTRACTOR WITH
   51  RESPECT TO A CONTRACT AND ANY SUCH JUDICIAL ACTIONS OR  PROCEEDINGS  AND
   52  MEDIATION  OR  ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS THAT ARE PRESENTLY PENDING OR FOR
   53  WHICH NOTICE OF CLAIM HAS BEEN RECEIVED.
   54    R. RECORD OF ALL SANCTIONS IMPOSED WITHIN THE PRIOR FIVE  YEARS  AS  A
   55  RESULT  OF  JUDICIAL  OR  ADMINISTRATIVE  DISCIPLINARY  PROCEEDINGS WITH

       A. 2409                             3

    1  RESPECT TO ANY PROFESSIONAL LICENSES HELD BY THE CONTRACTOR, OR A  PRIN-
    2  CIPAL OWNER OR OFFICER OF THE CONTRACTOR.
    3    S.  WHETHER STATE OF NEW YORK INCOME TAX RETURNS, WHERE REQUIRED, HAVE
    4  BEEN FILED FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.
    5    T. OUTSTANDING TAX WARRANTS AND UNSATISFIED TAX LIENS, AS REFLECTED IN
    6  THE RECORDS OF THE STATE.
    7    U. INFORMATION FROM PUBLIC REPORTS  OF  THE  ORGANIZED  CRIME  CONTROL
    8  BUREAU  AND THE NEW YORK STATE ORGANIZED CRIME TASK FORCE THAT INDICATES
    9  INVOLVEMENT IN CRIMINAL ACTIVITY.
   10    V. CRIMINAL PROCEEDINGS PENDING AGAINST THE CONTRACTOR AND ANY PRINCI-
   11  PAL OWNER OR OFFICER OF SUCH CONTRACTOR.
   12    W. RECORD OF ALL CRIMINAL CONVICTIONS OF THE CONTRACTOR,  ANY  CURRENT
   13  PRINCIPAL  OWNER  OR  OFFICER  FOR  ANY CRIME RELATED TO TRUTHFULNESS OR
   14  BUSINESS CONDUCT AND FOR ANY OTHER FELONY COMMITTED WITHIN THE PRIOR TEN
   15  YEARS, AND OF ANY FORMER PRINCIPAL OWNER OR OFFICER,  WITHIN  THE  PRIOR
   16  TEN YEARS, FOR ANY CRIME RELATED TO TRUTHFULNESS OR BUSINESS CONDUCT AND
   17  FOR  ANY  OTHER  FELONY  COMMITTED WHILE HE OR SHE HELD SUCH POSITION OR
   18  STATUS.
   19    X. ALL PENDING BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS AND ALL  BANKRUPTCY  PROCEEDINGS
   20  INITIATED  WITHIN  THE PAST SEVEN YEARS BY OR AGAINST THE CONTRACTOR AND
   21  ITS AFFILIATES.
   22    Y. WHETHER THE CONTRACTOR HAS CERTIFIED THAT IT  WAS  NOT  FOUNDED  OR
   23  ESTABLISHED  OR  IS NOT OPERATED IN A MANNER TO EVADE THE APPLICATION OR
   24  TO DEFEAT THE PURPOSE OF THIS SECTION AND IS NOT THE SUCCESSOR, ASSIGNEE
   25  OR AFFILIATE OF AN ENTITY WHICH IS  INELIGIBLE  TO  BID  OR  PROPOSE  ON
   26  CONTRACTS  OR AGAINST WHICH A PROCEEDING TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY TO BID
   27  OR PROPOSE ON CONTRACTS IS PENDING.
   28    Z. THE NAME AND MAIN BUSINESS ADDRESS OF  ANYONE  WHO  THE  CONTRACTOR
   29  RETAINED,  EMPLOYED  OR  DESIGNATED  TO  INFLUENCE  THE  PREPARATION  OF
   30  CONTRACT SPECIFICATIONS OR THE SOLICITATION OR AWARD OF THIS CONTRACT.
   31    3. WHEN PERSONNEL FROM ANY AGENCY OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY LEARN  THAT  THE
   32  CERTIFICATION REQUIRED BY PARAGRAPH Y OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION
   33  MAY  NOT  BE TRUTHFUL, THE APPROPRIATE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIAL SHALL BE
   34  IMMEDIATELY INFORMED OF SUCH FACT AND  THE  FACT  OF  SUCH  NOTIFICATION
   35  SHALL  BE  REFLECTED  IN  THE  DATABASE,  EXCEPT WHEN CONFIDENTIALITY IS
   36  REQUESTED BY THE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICIAL.
   37    4. INFORMATION REQUIRED FROM A CONTRACTOR CONSISTING OF A CONTRACTOR'S
   38  SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER SHALL BE OBTAINED BY THE AGENCY OR PUBLIC AUTHOR-
   39  ITY ENTERING INTO A CONTRACT AS  PART OF THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE TAXES
   40  ADMINISTERED BY THE STATE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE  FOR  THE
   41  PURPOSE  OF  ESTABLISHING THE IDENTIFICATION OF PERSONS AFFECTED BY SUCH
   42  TAXES.
   43    5. IN THE EVENT THAT PROCUREMENT OF GOODS,  SERVICES  OR  CONSTRUCTION
   44  MUST  BE  MADE  ON  AN  EMERGENCY BASIS, THE REQUIRED INFORMATION MAY BE
   45  SUBMITTED AFTER AWARD OF THE CONTRACT. HOWEVER, ALL OF  THE  INFORMATION
   46  REQUIRED  BY SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE SUBMITTED NO LATER
   47  THAN THIRTY DAYS FROM THE DATE OF THE AWARD.
   48    6. WHERE A CONTRACTOR OR SUBCONTRACTOR  BECOMES  OBLIGATED  TO  SUBMIT
   49  INFORMATION  REQUIRED  BY  THIS  SUBDIVISION  BY  REASON  OF HAVING BEEN
   50  AWARDED A CONTRACT OR SUBCONTRACT, THE VALUE OF WHICH,  WHEN  AGGREGATED
   51  WITH  THE  VALUE  OF ALL OTHER CONTRACTS OR SUBCONTRACTS AWARDED TO THAT
   52  CONTRACTOR   OR   SUBCONTRACTOR   DURING   THE   IMMEDIATELY   PRECEDING
   53  TWELVE-MONTH PERIOD, IS VALUED AT ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR MORE,
   54  SUCH  INFORMATION  SHALL  BE  SUBMITTED  NO LATER THAN THIRTY DAYS AFTER
   55  REGISTRATION OF THE CONTRACT WHICH RESULTED IN THE OBLIGATION TO  SUBMIT
   56  SUCH  INFORMATION.  A  CONTRACTOR  OR SUBCONTRACTOR WHO FAILS TO PROVIDE

       A. 2409                             4

    1  SUCH INFORMATION AS REQUIRED BY THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE INELIGIBLE  TO
    2  BID  OR  PROPOSE  ON A CONTRACT OR SUBCONTRACT UNTIL SUCH INFORMATION IS
    3  PROVIDED.
    4    7. NO CONTRACT FOR GOODS OR SERVICES INVOLVING THE EXPENDITURE OF MORE
    5  THAN  TEN THOUSAND DOLLARS OR IN THE CASE OF CONSTRUCTION, REPAIR, REHA-
    6  BILITATION OR ALTERATION, THE EXPENDITURE OF MORE THAN FIFTEEN  THOUSAND
    7  DOLLARS,  FRANCHISE  OR  CONCESSION  SHALL BE LET BY AN AGENCY OR PUBLIC
    8  AUTHORITY, UNLESS THE CONTRACT MANAGER OR OTHER PERSON  RESPONSIBLE  FOR
    9  MAKING  THE  RECOMMENDATION FOR AWARD HAS CERTIFIED THAT THESE COMPUTER-
   10  IZED DATABASES AND THE INFORMATION MAINTAINED PURSUANT TO  THIS  SECTION
   11  HAVE BEEN EXAMINED.
   12    8.  NOTHING  IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE DEEMED TO REQUIRE THE DISCLOSURE
   13  OF INFORMATION THAT IS CONFIDENTIAL OR PRIVILEGED OR THE  DISCLOSURE  OF
   14  WHICH WOULD BE CONTRARY TO LAW IN THE ABSENCE OF THIS SECTION.
   15    9. ANY CONTRACTOR OR SUBCONTRACTOR THAT HAS SUBMITTED TO ANY AGENCY OR
   16  PUBLIC  AUTHORITY  THE INFORMATION REQUIRED TO BE PROVIDED IN ACCORDANCE
   17  WITH SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE REQUIRED  TO  UPDATE  THAT
   18  INFORMATION  ONLY  AT  THREE-YEAR  INTERVALS,  EXCEPT  THAT  INFORMATION
   19  REQUIRED BY PARAGRAPHS N, O, Q, R, V, W AND X OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS
   20  SECTION SHALL BE UPDATED EACH TIME THE CONTRACTOR  OR  SUBCONTRACTOR  IS
   21  CONSIDERED  FOR  THE AWARD OF ANOTHER CONTRACT OR SUBCONTRACT, EXCEPT AS
   22  PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION FIVE OR SIX OF THIS SECTION, AND NO CONTRACT  OR
   23  SUBCONTRACT  SHALL BE AWARDED UNLESS THE CONTRACTOR OR SUBCONTRACTOR HAS
   24  CERTIFIED THAT INFORMATION PREVIOUSLY SUBMITTED AS TO THOSE REQUIREMENTS
   25  IS CORRECT AT THE TIME OF THE AWARD OF THE CONTRACT OR SUBCONTRACT.
   26    10. EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED, FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION:
   27    A. "AFFILIATE" SHALL MEAN  AN  ENTITY  IN  WHICH  THE  PARENT  OF  THE
   28  CONTRACTOR OWNS MORE THAN FIFTY PERCENT OF THE VOTING STOCK, OR AN ENTI-
   29  TY  IN  WHICH  A  GROUP  OF PRINCIPAL OWNERS WHICH OWNS MORE  THAN FIFTY
   30  PERCENT OF THE CONTRACTOR ALSO OWNS MORE THAN  FIFTY    PERCENT  OF  THE
   31  VOTING STOCK.
   32    B. "CAUTIONARY INFORMATION" SHALL MEAN, IN REGARD TO A CONTRACTOR, ANY
   33  ADVERSE  ACTION  BY  ANY  AGENCY  OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY, INCLUDING BUT NOT
   34  LIMITED TO  POOR  PERFORMANCE  EVALUATION,  DEFAULT,  NON-RESPONSIBILITY
   35  DETERMINATION, DEBARMENT, SUSPENSION, WITHDRAWAL OF PREQUALIFIED STATUS,
   36  OR DENIAL OF PREQUALIFIED STATUS.
   37    C.  "CONTRACT"  SHALL MEAN AND INCLUDE ANY AGREEMENT BETWEEN AN AGENCY
   38  OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY AND A CONTRACTOR, OR ANY AGREEMENT  BETWEEN  SUCH  A
   39  CONTRACTOR AND A SUBCONTRACTOR, WHICH (I) IS FOR THE PROVISION OF GOODS,
   40  SERVICES  OR  CONSTRUCTION AND HAS A VALUE THAT WHEN AGGREGATED WITH THE
   41  VALUES OF ALL OTHER SUCH AGREEMENTS WITH THE SAME CONTRACTOR OR  SUBCON-
   42  TRACTOR  AND ANY FRANCHISES OR CONCESSIONS AWARDED TO SUCH CONTRACTOR OR
   43  SUBCONTRACTOR DURING THE IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING  TWELVE-MONTH  PERIOD  IS
   44  VALUED  AT  ONE  HUNDRED  THOUSAND  DOLLARS  OR MORE; OR (II) IS FOR THE
   45  PROVISION OF GOODS, SERVICES OR CONSTRUCTION IS AWARDED TO A SOLE SOURCE
   46  AND IS VALUED AT TEN THOUSAND DOLLARS OR MORE; OR (III) IS A  CONCESSION
   47  AND  HAS  A  VALUE  THAT  WHEN  AGGREGATED  WITH  THE VALUE OF ALL OTHER
   48  CONTRACTS HELD BY THE SAME CONCESSIONAIRE IS VALUED AT ONE HUNDRED THOU-
   49  SAND DOLLARS OR MORE; OR (IV) IS A FRANCHISE.
   50    D. "CONTRACTOR" SHALL MEAN AND INCLUDE ALL INDIVIDUALS, SOLE  PROPRIE-
   51  TORSHIPS,  PARTNERSHIPS, JOINT VENTURES OR CORPORATIONS WHO ENTER INTO A
   52  CONTRACT, AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH C OF THIS SUBDIVISION, WITH AN  AGENCY
   53  OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY.
   54    E.  "OFFICER"  SHALL MEAN ANY INDIVIDUAL WHO SERVES AS CHIEF EXECUTIVE
   55  OFFICER, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, OR  CHIEF  OPERATING  OFFICER  OF  THE
   56  CONTRACTOR, BY WHATEVER TITLES KNOWN.

       A. 2409                             5

    1    F.  "PARENT"  SHALL  MEAN  AN INDIVIDUAL PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE OR
    2  CORPORATION, WHICH OWNS MORE THAN FIFTY PERCENT OF THE VOTING STOCK OF A
    3  CONTRACTOR.
    4    G.  "PRINCIPAL  OWNER"  SHALL  MEAN  AN INDIVIDUAL, PARTNERSHIP, JOINT
    5  VENTURE OR CORPORATION WHICH HOLDS A TEN PERCENT  OR  GREATER  OWNERSHIP
    6  INTEREST IN A CONTRACTOR OR SUBCONTRACTOR.
    7    H. "SUBCONTRACT" SHALL MEAN ANY CONTRACT, AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH C OF
    8  THIS SUBDIVISION, BETWEEN A SUBCONTRACTOR AND A CONTRACTOR.
    9    I.  "SUBCONTRACTOR"  SHALL  MEAN  AN  INDIVIDUAL, SOLE PROPRIETORSHIP,
   10  PARTNERSHIP, JOINT VENTURE OR CORPORATION WHICH IS ENGAGED BY A CONTRAC-
   11  TOR PURSUANT TO A CONTRACT, AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH C OF  THIS  SUBDIVI-
   12  SION.
   13    11.  THE  STATE  COMPTROLLER MAY ENTER INTO COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS FOR
   14  THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION WITH ANY MUNICIPALITY THAT MAINTAINS A DATA-
   15  BASE SUBSTANTIALLY SIMILAR TO THE ONE REQUIRED BY THIS SECTION.
   16    S 3. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   17  have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to establishing a responsible bidders database in the office of the state comptroller
